body:
Comment 3: 
I'm sorry about RHEL 5 working even less well now than it used to, but it's just too
much effort to keep working. It's ancient. If Go 1.0.3 is working for you, my suggestion
is to keep using that.

I believe that as of January 8, 2013, RHEL 5 has exited "production 1" and is now in
"production 2" stage. That means that RedHat will stop releasing software updates for
it. I hope that will cause many users to switch to a newer Linux distribution.

https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/errata/
_Status changed to **Unfortunate**._
